translation: O Brothers! Chant “Hari”! Chant “Hari”! Chant “Hari”! Gaurāṅga and Nitāi have brought the Lord’s Name. (Oh! They see our suffering.)

text: hari-nāma vinā jīvera anya dhana nāi re
translation: The soul has no wealth other than the Lord’s Name. Oh! Jagāi and Mādhāi were purified by the Lord’s Name (Oh! They were great sinners).

text: michhe māyā-baddha ha’ye jīvana kāṭāi re
āśā-vaśe ghure’ ghure’ āra kothā yāi re
translation: Bound by Māyā (claiming ‘I’ and ‘mine’), I pass my life in vain. Oh! Controlled by mundane desires, wandering and wandering, where shall I go next? (Oh! Mundane desires never end).

text: hari bale deo bhāi āśāra mukhe chhāi re
translation: O brothers! Chant “Hari!” and throw ashes in the face of material desire. (Oh! Being desireless is happiness). Abandoning desire for mundane enjoyment and liberation, I chant the Lord’s Name (being spiritually pure).

text: nā cheye-o nāmera guṇe o saba phala pāi re
vinoda bale yāi la’ye nāmera bālāi re
translation: Even without desiring them, I obtain all ends (dharma, artha, kāma, and mokṣa) by the Name’s power. (Oh! Abandon all endeavours for insignificant ends). Bhakti Vinod says, “I proceed, removing the obstacles to the Lord’s Name. (Oh! Avoid the obstacles to the Lord’s Name.)”
